title.narrative: Improving Protection and Living Conditions and Reducing Vulnerabilities of Crisis-Affected Populations in North-East Nigeria

description.narrative: The crisis in conflict-affected north-east Nigeria continues to be one of the gravest in the world today, marked by armed conflict, forced displacement and severe violations of civilians’ human rights and dignity. Internally displaced persons (IDPs) in and outside camps have weak coping mechanisms and are reliant on humanitarian assistance to survive and improve their living conditions. With this project, IOM is focusing its efforts on providing multi-sector assistance to IDPs, returnees and host communities and an overall displacement and operating picture to tailor the humanitarian response. In line with IOM’s Global COVID-19 Strategic Response and Recovery Plan (SRRP), IOM`s approach under this action encompasses life-saving assistance and response to humanitarian needs as well as initiatives to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 on migrants and societies. Direct assistance will pertain to the following sectors of assistance; camp coordination and camp management; shelter and non-food items; water, sanitation and hygiene; mental health and psychosocial support. Additionally, the organization will continue to provide inter-agency services through the maintenance and operation of humanitarian hubs, and the implementation of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM).
